title: Snakedance
dialogue_triumphs: I offer you fear in a handful of dust

continuity_notes.name: Tegan
continuity_notes.description: A companion of the Doctor, who lived in a house with a garden and a tree when she was six years old.

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: Time Lord protagonist, who spends a whole episode behind bars without his lock-picks.
continuity_notes.current_status: Imprisoned during part of the story

continuity_notes.name: The Mara
continuity_notes.description: A malevolent entity that once ruled the Sumaran empire, defeated 500 years ago but escaped to Deva Loka.

continuity_notes.name: Blue Crystals
continuity_notes.description: Manufactured in zero gravity to ensure no imperfections, with properties similar to those of Metebelis 3.

roots: Native American culture (the Hopi Snakedance ritual)
Evelyn Waugh's A Handful of Dust
T. S. Eliot (especially The Wasteland and The Four Quartets)

locations.name: Manussa
locations.description: A planet in the Scrampus system, former center of the Manussan Empire, later Sumaran Empire.
locations.origin: Colony of a Federation formed by one of Lon's ancestors

additional_notes: Fashion Victims: Ambril's pink and black fur hat, Lon's collar.
bottom_line: Not quite as gorgeous as 'Kinda', since it almost tries to be a normal Doctor Who, and therefore doesn't quite have the depth, but it's still wonderful. For once, we see the Doctor as others see him, a raving idiot with no justification for his wild claims of world destruction. It's a wonder Chela believes him.
